Welcome to Creative Practice Essentials

Please begin this module by reviewing the module handbook. You will find additional information such as the weekly schedule, learning methods, and essential resources. Students are responsible for reading the content of this document. For further information, contact your instructor

View module handbook

Module Outline

This module will introduce you to workshops focusing on drawing, visual studies, research skills, digital skills, and software knowledge. Within the module, you will explore different approaches to mark-making and visual observation, which are essential research elements for creating visual images. Additional workshops will introduce you to Adobe software and how digital skills can complement traditional art and design knowledge.

By completing this module, you will acquire practical art and design knowledge, enhancing your ability to explore personal ideas and engage in undergraduate studies with increased confidence and creativity. This module serves as an introduction, preparing you for specialized study on the Contemporary Creative Practices Programme (CCP). The teaching exercises will support you in developing a strong foundation in art and design knowledge and practical skills. Furthermore, you will learn to critically approach visual communication and image-making, utilizing both traditional and digital approaches, techniques, and media.

Learning Outcomes

By the end of this module, you will be able to:

.

Conduct research that challenges preconceptions and informs ideas and personal development

.

Explore the characteristics and relevance of a range of different media, techniques and approaches

.

Critically evaluate the potential uses and application of media experiments

.

Apply a range of media and alternative media combinations to create innovative work that communicates a personal response

.

Resolve problems and produce solutions through the considered application of research and theoretical knowledge

Assessments

  • Creative Practice Portfolio : This will demonstrate your independence, creative development, and personal response to each of the teaching activities covered during the 6-week module: (100%25)

Assessment dates

Please note and manage your submission dates, they are important, and you must submit your assessments before the deadline. It is NOT possible to request an extension. The University will NOT send reminders if your submission is late or if you do not submit at all. If there are exceptional circumstances outside your control (for example, serious illness) affecting your ability to submit on time, you can download an Exceptional Circumstances (EC) formLinks to an external site..

Module Leader

.

Module Leader: Nguyen Quang Vinh

Nguyen Quang Vinh

Quang Vinh earned a Bachelor's degree in Fine Arts from the Central Academy of Fine Arts, Beijing, China, and pursued a career as an artist while teaching at Hanoi Architectural University and Hoa Binh University. In 2014, he completed a MA in Fine Art at AKV | St. Joost School of Art and Design in The Netherlands, later lecturing in the Multimedia Communication department at Vietnam Women's Academy and in Design Studies at RMIT. He continues to exhibit his work internationally, including shows in New York, Paris, and The Netherlands.

week1.body:
Welcome to week 1

Get started this week by watching our playlist on the seven elements of art. By the end of this week, you should have a firm understanding of line, shape, colour, form, texture, value, and space, and be able to identify those elements in an art object.

.

LESSON CONTENT

  1. Prework: Continue watching our playlist to learn about the seven elements of art - shape, colour, texture, line, form, value, and space.

  2. Lecture: Learn the fundamental building blocks of art, such as colour, shape, form, and balance. We'll pick a design object from within contemporary Vietnamese culture and analyse using these concepts.

  3. Visual Studies: Learn about basic techniques and how to use your equipment. This session will include line, shape, textures, form, and shading techniques, focusing on dry media such as charcoal, pastel, and pencil. You will use trace your object using visual annotations to analyse all the individual elements.

  4. Research Skills: What is the difference between visual and scientific research? Discover your own field of interest. Draw on your interests from music, literature, film, and reflect on your own daily creative flow.

  5. Digital skills: We will focus on how to get the best of your camera phone and how to use it properly. You will take a photo of your design object and edit it using Photoshop. You will also learn more about your mobile device and scanner.

.

STUDY MATERIALS

  • Virtual Studio: Your own virtual space to display your work and view others'. See weekly breakdowns for your group, and get your work show in the HALL OF FAME!

  • Art Supplies: Find out about the art materials you'll need and where to buy them.

  • Shading Techniques: Watch this tutorial to learn about shading techniques such as hatching, circling, and blending.

  • PPT: Lecture

  • PPT: Visual Studies

  • PPT: Research Skills

  • PPT: Digital Skills

.

Show your work, exchange ideas, and get have fun in your virtual studio

week2.body:
Welcome to week 2

This week we are going to look at ways of experimenting with drawing materials and techniques. The process of creating mark and mark making will suggest you to develope further your own design or analysis of the object. By the end of this lesson you should be able to explore the characteristics and relevance of a range of different media, techniques and approaches.

.

LESSON CONTENT

  1. Lecture: Learn the ways artist and desiger communicate through the Elements of art. You will be assigned an art studio to upload your weekly practices and exchange ideas with other students

  2. Visual Studies: Experiment with different drawing materials (pencil, charcoal, ink or pastels) and techniques (dry drawing and wet drawing). After the process of mark-making you will develop further your ideas with your chosen design object.

  3. Research skill: What are your keywords from your field of interest? How can you draw out of the bigger picture of your art/design project? What is your favourite artist and art work?

  4. Digital skill: We will focus on how to get the best of your camera phone and how to use it properly. You will take a photo of your design object and edit it using Photoshop. You will also learn more about your mobile device and scanner.

.

STUDY MATERIALS

  • Virtual Studio: Your own virtual space to display your work and view others'. See weekly breakdowns for your group, and get your work show in the HALL OF FAME!

  • Art Supplies: Find out some interesting extra materials you can experiment with around Hanoi art stores.

  • Digital skill Images: Starter pack provide you some textures, images to start working on your selection and blending modes skills.

.

Show your work, exchange ideas, and get have fun in your virtual studio

week3.body:
Welcome to week 3

Experiment, experiment and more experiment!!! Experiment is the key for successful in art and design making. This week we are going to learn how to use automatic drawing technique in your creative process and use it as a tool for overcome the creative block. On the other hand we will learn how to visualize our keywords and our feeling with the visual language. By the end of this lesson you should be able to apply a range of media and alternative media combinations to create innovative work that communicates a personal response.

.

LESSON CONTENT

  1. Lecture: What is automatic drawing? How can we use this technique in our creative process? Study some examples of work that can communicate with your personal keywords and feelings.

  2. Visual Studies: Transfer your keywords into visual language and exloring the potential use of automatic drawing. The visual studies tutorial will guide you through the process of creating a drawing which respond to your personal feelings.

  3. Research skill: Visualize your keywords in mind map and develop them further with visual references.

  4. Digital skill: Introduction to layer mask. Basic filter setup. Clean up images. Start collage project.

.

STUDY MATERIALS

  • Automatic drawing: Experience artist talk about his process of thinking with automatic drawing technique.

  • Automatic drawing exhibition: Interesting drawing activites and showcase for the potential outcome with automatic drawing technique.

  • Collage art: Inspriation works from collage artists

.

Show your work, exchange ideas, and get have fun in your virtual studio
